item.title: Every day in Python AtCoder #44
item.description: ### Introduction Last time Solve 5 boot camp problems #44 ABC056-C Thoughts The sum of non-negative integers up to i is $\frac{1}{2}n(n+1)$}}. This sum becomes $X$ when $\frac{1}{2}n(n+1)=X$, and when solving for $n$, $n=\frac{-1\pm{ It will be \sqrt{8X+1}}}{2}$. If you add the ceil symbol to the solution of this equation, it becomes $\lceil \frac{-1\pm{\sqrt{8X+1}}}{2} \rceil$. This is the answer. import math x = int(input()) f = (-1+math.sqrt(8*x+1)) / 2 print(math.

item.title: [Python] ABC159D (College Mathematics nCr) [AtCoder]
item.description: Competitive professionals will prepare notebooks and pens! ! ! (Especially if a mathematical formula comes out) #ABC159D Difficulty:417 This time I will explain the explanation w First, quote from Explanation. ① Number of methods to select two different balls with the same written integer from N balls (2) Number of methods to select a ball in which the same integer as the kth ball is written from the N-1 balls excluding the kth ball Can be obtained by subtracting the latter from the former.

item.title: People who want to clear the D problem at ABC of AtCoder scratched the foot
item.description: ## Introduction An amateur writer tried AtCoder Beginner Contest several times. Language is python However, after the D problem, I have no teeth. For these problems, it is required to estimate the amount of calculation + how to use algorithms or libraries to improve processing speed or mathematical knowledge. It’s difficult and seems to vomit, but it’s funny. If you don’t solve it Purpose Learn how to solve AtCoder’s D-rank problem (400 points).
